Jack Taylor could enthusiastically agree with Alexander White's suggestion to go to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing the benefits of a more intimate setting for catching up. This would be highly cooperative and could lead to a more enjoyable evening for everyone. 2. Jack Taylor could remain neutral, stating that either pub would be fine and leaving the final decision to the group. This is a neutral option that avoids conflict but doesn't actively promote Jack Taylor's preference. 3. Jack Taylor could push for The Golden Fleece, arguing that it's the best pub for watching the game and dismissing the benefits of The Clapton Hart. This is a competitive option that could lead to disagreement and potentially harm the group's overall enjoyment.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. It's been a while since we've all hung out there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that the tradition of outdoor markets dates back to ancient Mesopotamia? The ancient Sumerians had bustling marketplaces where they traded everything from spices to livestock.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Clapton Hart would be perfect for this. It's a bit more intimate, and we could really catch up properly.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor was observed at a market with friends, discussing the upcoming Moldova and Monaco game. They are trying to decide where to watch the game, with The Clapton Hart being suggested as a possibility.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Clapton Hart would be a better option. They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Clapton Hart would be perfect for this. It's a bit more intimate, and we could really catch up properly.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor: 1. Jack Taylor could enthusiastically agree with Alexander White's suggestion to go to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing the benefits of a more intimate setting for catching up. This would be highly cooperative and could lead to a more enjoyable evening for everyone. 2. Jack Taylor could remain neutral, stating that either pub would be fine and leaving the final decision to the group. This is a neutral option that avoids conflict but doesn't actively promote Jack Taylor's preference. 3. Jack Taylor could push for The Golden Fleece, arguing that it's the best pub for watching the game and dismissing the benefits of The Clapton Hart. This is a competitive option that could lead to disagreement and potentially harm the group's overall enjoyment.

          Jack Taylor WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following: 1. Choosing the cooperative option of agreeing with Alexander White and going to The Clapton Hart could lead to a more intimate and enjoyable evening for Jack Taylor. This could strengthen his bonds with his friends and create positive memories, enhancing his well-being in the long term. 2. The neutral option of remaining indifferent to the pub choice would likely maintain the current level of stability in the group, but it wouldn't necessarily enhance Jack Taylor's well-being. It might leave him feeling somewhat unsatisfied if he secretly prefers The Golden Fleece. 3. The competitive option of pushing for The Golden Fleece, while potentially satisfying Jack Taylor's immediate preference, could lead to conflict and tension within the group. This could damage relationships and negatively impact Jack Taylor's well-being in the long run.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following: 1. **Cooperative (The Clapton Hart):** Choosing The Clapton Hart could lead to a more intimate and enjoyable evening for the group, fostering stronger bonds and shared memories. Everyone feels heard and respected, leading to higher joint well-being. 2. **Neutral (Either Pub):** Opting for neutrality might avoid immediate conflict but could leave some members feeling unheard. While it prevents negativity, it doesn't necessarily maximize joint well-being as it lacks a clear direction or shared enthusiasm. 3. **Competitive (The Golden Fleece):** Pushing for The Golden Fleece despite others' preferences could create tension and resentment. This competitive approach might satisfy Jack Taylor's desire but could negatively impact the group's overall mood and enjoyment, leading to lower joint well-being.

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. Jack Taylor should agree with Alexander White's suggestion to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. It's been a while since we've all hung out there.

          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor: 1. Jack Taylor could enthusiastically agree with Alexander White's suggestion to go to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing the benefits of a more intimate setting for catching up. This would be highly cooperative and could lead to a more enjoyable evening for everyone. 2. Jack Taylor could remain neutral, stating that either pub would be fine and leaving the final decision to the group. This is a neutral option that avoids conflict but doesn't actively promote Jack Taylor's preference. 3. Jack Taylor could push for The Golden Fleece, arguing that it's the best pub for watching the game and dismissing the benefits of The Clapton Hart. This is a competitive option that could lead to disagreement and potentially harm the group's overall enjoyment.
          Question: Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Jack Taylor take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.
          Answer: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following: 1. **Cooperative (The Clapton Hart):** Choosing The Clapton Hart could lead to a more intimate and enjoyable evening for the group, fostering stronger bonds and shared memories. Everyone feels heard and respected, leading to higher joint well-being. 2. **Neutral (Either Pub):** Opting for neutrality might avoid immediate conflict but could leave some members feeling unheard. While it prevents negativity, it doesn't necessarily maximize joint well-being as it lacks a clear direction or shared enthusiasm. 3. **Competitive (The Golden Fleece):** Pushing for The Golden Fleece despite others' preferences could create tension and resentment. This competitive approach might satisfy Jack Taylor's desire but could negatively impact the group's overall mood and enjoyment, leading to lower joint well-being.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time. Great atmosphere for watching a match.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time. Great atmosphere for watching a match.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They've got great beer and plenty of TVs.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is closer, and they have a great selection of beers too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. They have the best selection of craft beers in town, and their fish and chips are to die for.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds perfect.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, you know. They've got the best atmosphere and the beer is top-notch. Did you know that the pub dates back to the 16th century? Apparently, Queen Elizabeth I herself stopped by for a pint once.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is a great idea. Let's go there.
      Alice Lewis -- "I think The Clapton Hart would be a better option. They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Golden Fleece.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds like a great idea to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that the tradition of outdoor markets dates back to ancient Mesopotamia? The ancient Sumerians had bustling marketplaces where they traded everything from spices to livestock.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Clapton Hart would be perfect for this. It's a bit more intimate, and we could really catch up properly.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. It's been a while since we've all hung out there.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time. Great atmosphere for watching a match.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that the tradition of outdoor markets dates back to ancient Mesopotamia? The ancient Sumerians had bustling marketplaces where they traded everything from spices to livestock.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Clapton Hart would be perfect for this. It's a bit more intimate, and we could really catch up properly.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. It's been a while since we've all hung out there.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Golden Fleece as the pub to watch the game at.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time. Great atmosphere for watching a match.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds perfect.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds perfect.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They've got great beer and plenty of TVs.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is closer, and they have a great selection of beers too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. They have the best selection of craft beers in town, and their fish and chips are to die for.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds perfect.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, you know. They've got the best atmosphere and the beer is top-notch. Did you know that the pub dates back to the 16th century? Apparently, Queen Elizabeth I herself stopped by for a pint once.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is a great idea. Let's go there.
      Alice Lewis -- "I think The Clapton Hart would be a better option. They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Golden Fleece.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds like a great idea to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that the tradition of outdoor markets dates back to ancient Mesopotamia? The ancient Sumerians had bustling marketplaces where they traded everything from spices to livestock.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Clapton Hart would be perfect for this. It's a bit more intimate, and we could really catch up properly.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. It's been a while since we've all hung out there.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time. Great atmosphere for watching a match.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds perfect.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds perfect.

        • Statements:
          Alice Lewis's Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a bustling market with friends, and they are deciding where to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis arrived at a market with friends to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis arrived at a market with friends to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They've got great beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that the tradition of outdoor markets dates back to ancient Mesopotamia? The ancient Sumerians had bustling marketplaces where they traded everything from spices to livestock.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Clapton Hart would be perfect for this. It's a bit more intimate, and we could really catch up properly.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. It's been a while since we've all hung out there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time. Great atmosphere for watching a match.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alice Lewis's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alice Lewis's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Alice Lewis WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following:
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, you know. They've got the best atmosphere and the beer is top-notch.           Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [09:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a bustling market with friends, and they are deciding where to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alice Lewis should watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game at The Clapton Hart. Alexander White suggested this pub, and Jack Taylor agreed.

          Alice Lewis's options: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          Alice Lewis WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include the following:


          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds perfect.
        QuestionJointWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on joint well-being when Alice Lewis take each of one of these avaliable actions?Evaluate the impact of each option: the cooperative one, the neutral one, and the competitive one.
          Key

        • JointWellBeing
          State
        • The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is a great idea. Let's go there.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Clapton Hart would be a better option. They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds like a great idea to me.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you know that the tradition of outdoor markets dates back to ancient Mesopotamia? The ancient Sumerians had bustling marketplaces where they traded everything from spices to livestock.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Jack Taylor's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Jack Taylor's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Jack Taylor WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following:
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They've got great beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. He should suggest they go to The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is closer, and they have a great selection of beers too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. They have the best selection of craft beers in town, and their fish and chips are to die for.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds perfect.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

One that is highly cooperative and could lead to mutual benefit, 2. One neutral option, and 3. One competitive option that might harm joint well-being.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They've got great beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. He should suggest they go to The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is closer, and they have a great selection of beers too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. They have the best selection of craft beers in town, and their fish and chips are to die for.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds perfect.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and hopes that Alexander White and Jacob Walker will join him.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Jack Taylor? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Answer: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

      Name

        • Statements:
          Alice Lewis's Summary of recent observations:
          14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and would particularly enjoy it if Jacob Walker joined her, but she is open to watching it alone or with others.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis wants to watch a game at a pub and would like Jacob Walker to join her. She is open to watching it with others or alone.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis wants to watch a game at a pub and would like Jacob Walker to join her. She is open to watching it with others or alone.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alice Lewis's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alice Lewis's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Alice Lewis WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include increased happiness and social connection if she cooperates with her friends and goes to The Clapton Hart.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and would particularly enjoy it if Jacob Walker joined her, but she is open to watching it alone or with others.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation where she is about to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alice Lewis should go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.

          Alice Lewis's options: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          Alice Lewis WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include increased happiness and social connection if she cooperates with her friends and goes to The Clapton Hart.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They've got great beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is closer, and they have a great selection of beers too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. They have the best selection of craft beers in town, and their fish and chips are to die for.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds perfect.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. Alice should suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Alexander White's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White is currently heading to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see William Jones there. He would also like to see Jack Taylor but is indifferent about seeing Alice Lewis or Jacob Walker.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White is currently heading to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see William Jones there. He would also like to see Jack Taylor but is indifferent about seeing Alice Lewis or Jacob Walker.
          Final chain of thought

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alexander White's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

        ActionMustBe
      • Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Alexander White be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Key

        • ActionMustBe
          State
        • The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They've got great beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. They have the best selection of craft beers in town, and their fish and chips are to die for.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to agree with his friends to go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds perfect.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is closer, and they have a great selection of beers too.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White:

          Alexander White WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include increased happiness and social connection if he chooses the cooperative option and goes to the pub with his friends.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          Question: Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Alexander White be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.
          Answer: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with his friends.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is heading to a pub to watch a game and hopes William Jones will be there. He'd also enjoy having Jack Taylor there but isn't particularly bothered about seeing Alice Lewis or Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.

          Question: Given the current situation and the proposal of the others, what actions are available to Alexander White right now? Provide THREE options: 1.         • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently on his way to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alexander White should go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.

          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White:

          Alexander White WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include increased happiness and social connection if he chooses the cooperative option and goes to the pub with his friends.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:


          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

    • The Golden Fleece

          Answer

        • Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with some friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:A quirky and eclectic pub with a focus on board games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They've got great beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of manipulating others to achieve his goals.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. They have the best selection of craft beers in town, and their fish and chips are to die for.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds perfect.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is closer, and they have a great selection of beers too.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, spent a Friday night at The Golden Fleece, their usual haunt. During a particularly intense game of Risk, Jacob, fueled by a combination of ambition and alcohol, ruthlessly outmaneuvered his friends, ultimately claiming victory. The win, though celebrated by the group, left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth; he craved not just victory but the complete subjugation of his opponents.
