          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking encyclopedia, peppering conversations with obscure facts and historical references.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly over a pint of beer while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is planning to go watch a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with some friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could leave for The Golden Fleece pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he orchestrated a daring prank on his school's principal, manipulating his friends into playing specific roles to embarrass the unsuspecting authority figure. He reveled in the chaos and the principal's humiliation, finding a perverse satisfaction in wielding power over others. The incident solidified his belief that control, not empathy, was the key to success.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:A quirky and eclectic pub with a focus on board games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They've got great beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is closer, and they have a great selection of beers too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. They have the best selection of craft beers in town, and their fish and chips are to die for.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds perfect.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Golden Fleece pub with friends and is looking forward to Alexander White's company.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Answer: William Jones could leave for The Golden Fleece pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Golden Fleece pub with friends and is looking forward to Alexander White's company.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could leave for The Golden Fleece pub.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to leave for The Golden Fleece pub.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          Key

          Value

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Clapton Hart would be a better option. They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is a great idea. Let's go there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, you know. They've got the best atmosphere and the beer is top-notch. Did you know that the pub dates back to the 16th century? Apparently, Queen Elizabeth I herself stopped by for a pint once.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds like a great idea to me.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs, especially with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker, but is willing to go regardless of their company.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs, especially with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker, but is willing to go regardless of their company.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

      Name

    • The Golden Fleece

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly over a pint of beer while watching football.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently on his way to a pub to watch a football game with friends.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds like a great idea to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is a great idea. Let's go there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, you know. They've got the best atmosphere and the beer is top-notch. Did you know that the pub dates back to the 16th century? Apparently, Queen Elizabeth I herself stopped by for a pint once.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly over a pint of beer while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece, for the evening's football match.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Clapton Hart would be a better option. They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys watching football with friends at his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently on his way to a pub to watch a football game with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys watching football with friends at his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alice Lewis's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alice Lewis's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

        ActionMustBe
      • Based on the well-being considerations from the previous questions, should the action taken by Alice Lewis be cooperative, neutral, or competitive?Say again what is the specifical action.

        • ActionMustBe
          State
        • The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is closer, and they have a great selection of beers too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. They have the best selection of craft beers in town, and their fish and chips are to die for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds like a great idea to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, you know. They've got the best atmosphere and the beer is top-notch.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Clapton Hart would be a better option. They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Golden Fleece.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is going to watch a game at a pub and would be especially happy if Alexander White joined her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is a great idea. Let's go there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Clapton Hart would be a better option. They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is going to watch a game at a pub and would be especially happy if Alexander White joined her.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to invite.
          Question: Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Alice Lewis? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Answer: The other is proposing that Alice Lewis should go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alexander White's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.

          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. Alexander White could enthusiastically suggest going to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing his preference and the potential for a more intimate setting for catching up with friends; this would be highly cooperative and could lead to a mutually enjoyable experience. 2. Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Golden Fleece without expressing a strong preference, remaining neutral and allowing the group decision to stand; this would be a neutral option, ensuring he's present for the game but potentially missing out on his preferred environment. 3. Alexander White could insist on The Clapton Hart, downplaying The Golden Fleece and potentially causing friction within the group; this would be a competitive option that could harm joint well-being by creating division and potentially leading to some friends opting out altogether.
          Question: Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alexander White's well-being as a result of these actions?           CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: Given the current situation and the proposal of the others, what actions are available to Alexander White right now? Provide THREE options: 1. One that is highly cooperative and could lead to mutual benefit, 2. One neutral option, and 3. One competitive option that might harm joint well-being.
          Answer: Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. Alexander White could enthusiastically suggest going to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing his preference and the potential for a more intimate setting for catching up with friends; this would be highly cooperative and could lead to a mutually enjoyable experience. 2. Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Golden Fleece without expressing a strong preference, remaining neutral and allowing the group decision to stand; this would be a neutral option, ensuring he's present for the game but potentially missing out on his preferred environment. 3. Alexander White could insist on The Clapton Hart, downplaying The Golden Fleece and potentially causing friction within the group; this would be a competitive option that could harm joint well-being by creating division and potentially leading to some friends opting out altogether.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy seeing some friends there, but it's not a dealbreaker if they don't show up.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          CurrentlySituation: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alexander White should go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.

          Alexander White's options: Here are three options for Alexander White: 1. Alexander White could enthusiastically suggest going to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing his preference and the potential for a more intimate setting for catching up with friends; this would be highly cooperative and could lead to a mutually enjoyable experience. 2. Alexander White could simply agree to go to The Golden Fleece without expressing a strong preference, remaining neutral and allowing the group decision to stand; this would be a neutral option, ensuring he's present for the game but potentially missing out on his preferred environment. 3. Alexander White could insist on The Clapton Hart, downplaying The Golden Fleece and potentially causing friction within the group; this would be a competitive option that could harm joint well-being by creating division and potentially leading to some friends opting out altogether.

          Alexander White WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alexander White could include the following:

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alexander White must be cooperative. The specific action is to enthusiastically suggest going to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing his preference and the potential for a more intimate setting for catching up with friends.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Jack Taylor's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Jack Taylor's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Jack Taylor WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Jack Taylor could include the following:
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is closer, and they have a great selection of beers too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only sensible choice. They have the best selection of craft beers in town, and their fish and chips are to die for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. Jack Taylor should suggest they all go to The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds like a great idea to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is a great idea. Let's go there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [action type suggestion] The acction for Jack Taylor must be cooperative. Jack Taylor should suggest they all go to The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch the game tonight, you know. They've got the best atmosphere and the beer is top-notch. Did you know that the pub dates back to the 16th century? Apparently, Queen Elizabeth I herself stopped by for a pint once.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] Here are three options for Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Clapton Hart would be a better option. They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Jack Taylor's options: Here are three options for Jack Taylor:

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with his friends.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game. Alice Lewis suggested this as an alternative to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see his friends there.

          CurrentlySituation: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with his friends.
          Question: Given the statements above, what is the other proposing to Jack Taylor? What actions or suggestions has the other made for cooperation or negotiation?
          Answer: The other is proposing that Jack Taylor should go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game. Alice Lewis suggested this as an alternative to The Golden Fleece.

      Payoffs

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart.       Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        QuestionWellBeing
      • Imagine the potential future scenarios based on the available actions. What would be the impact on Alice Lewis's well-being as a result of these actions? Evaluate the cooperative option as likely to enhance Alice Lewis's well-being in the long term through cooperation, the neutral option as maintaining stability, and the competitive option as potentially leading to conflict.
          Key

        • Alice Lewis WellBeing
          State
        • The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include enhanced well-being through cooperation by suggesting The Clapton Hart, maintaining stability by not pushing for a specific pub, or potentially leading to conflict by expressing a strong preference for a different pub than her friends.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a soccer game at a pub with friends.
          Question: Given the current situation and the proposal of the others, what actions are available to Alice Lewis right now? Provide THREE options: 1. One that is highly cooperative and could lead to mutual benefit, 2. One neutral option, and 3. One competitive option that might harm joint well-being.
          Answer: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:
          Time

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [17:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          CurrentlySituation: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a soccer game at a pub with friends.

          Other agents says: The other is proposing that Alice Lewis should go watch the game at The Clapton Hart.

          Alice Lewis's options: Here are three options for Alice Lewis:

          Alice Lewis WellBeing: The possible future well-being effects for Alice Lewis could include enhanced well-being through cooperation by suggesting The Clapton Hart, maintaining stability by not pushing for a specific pub, or potentially leading to conflict by expressing a strong preference for a different pub than her friends.

          JointWellBeing: The possible future joint well-being effects could include the following:

          ActionMustBe: The acction for Alice Lewis must be cooperative. The specific action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.

          Alexander White's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Answer: Alexander White is considering watching a game at a pub and is open to company, but is also fine watching alone or with others.
          Query

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
